attributes.action: Introduce transparency in property conveycing related charges
attributes.background: When you buy/sell/remortgage a property, the conveyncing solicitors gives you a quote to start with but the final bill is usually twice the quote (specially when buying). You dont even understand the charges they mention in the bill, nor you get a choice at that point and it feels like extortion.
attributes.additional_details: Solicitors fees are usually fixed but other hidden charges increases the finaly bill to twice or even more sometimes. For eg. 1) 'Ground Landlord notice fee' £100! Just to notify the council (land owner) that there is a change in owner. Telegraphic transfer fee £45 (you pay this twice if 2 transfers are to be made). There should transparency in these costs and some standardisation where possible.

attributes.action: Get blocked up or unused property made available to the homeless
attributes.background: There are thousands of unused properties throughout the UK and there are thousands of homeless people. Open the unused properties and via a charity, make these properties available to the homeless.

attributes.action: Stop the eyesight test for the driving practical test.
attributes.background: For anyone going to be doing their driving test or is doing it, I think the eyesight test should not be in place. As long as we can see clearly that's all that matters, I don't see the point in having to read a number plate at a distance. Sign this petition help get the eyesight test removed
attributes.additional_details:
Well for those who fail and keep failing their driving test. if we fail so many times then get a refund. I have failed a few times and still booking for more.

Would be fair if we are able to get a refund for the driving test booking fee if we fail 3 times.

attributes.action: Pay for free access to M6 Toll during planned roadworks on the M5/M6 this year.
attributes.background: The M5 viaduct between junctions 1 and 2 is being repaired this year. Each carriageway will be closed in turn to allow the deck to be replaced causing the liability of severe congestion. This will back up in both directions. Add repairs to M6 junction 7 and the likelihood is chaos.
attributes.additional_details:
Opening the M6 Toll would take some of the pressure off the M6 for traffic heading to London and other south eastern areas, and off the M5 as traffic could head round the M42.

The costs to the economy of traffic being delayed will be huge.

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/highways-england-begins-vital-maintenance-work-on-m6

http://www.expressandstar.com/news/transport-news/2016/11/14/m5-roadworks-motorists-facing-months-of-misery-with-repairs-planned-to-crumbling-viaduct/

attributes.action: Stop university grants to be given based on household income in The UK.
attributes.background: As many people my age from 18-21, it's ridiculous that the government expect for a household income to have a link between my financial status and a household income, and a greater majority will have no financial help from these 'dependant people'.
attributes.additional_details: I believe this needs to be re-looked at and this is not not blindlessly asking for more money for everyone but letting those who need help and work hard for themselves with no financial help not struggle!

attributes.action: Sociology should be taught across all key stages, starting from primary school
attributes.background: Sociology is fundamental in understanding our social world, and this gives the opportunity to develop critical thinking skills.This is a positive thing, as people can share their views and in doing this, improving society. Sociology is important as it explains our functioning in daily life.
attributes.additional_details: 'I had always looked down on sociology as this arriviste discipline. It didn't have the noble history of English and history as a subject. But once I had a little exposure to it, I said, 'Hey, here's the key. Here's the key to understanding life and all its forms.' Tom Wolfe

attributes.action: private rented properties should be checked and certified  by council yearly.
attributes.background: council should check every property before allowing them to be rented out and should make a certain rules for estate agent to deal with tenant and protecting them.
attributes.additional_details: the flat i am renting is full of moulds, when i send my complain to estate agent in stead of resolving it and send me eviction letter !!! i am asking local council to protect tenants.

attributes.action: Bring back 05 armed forces pensions. New employment model for new recruits only
attributes.background: Armed forces pensions should not be altered from what people sign up for. Getting half way through your career and then to have the contract essentially ripped up is unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details: People join the armed forces for what is available at the time that includes the benefits and obviously the pension. This enabled people to start a fresh career after 22 years of service with a pension to help the transition. The contract should simply not be thrown out especially as members serving have no say in the matter. The new employment model is a betrayal on our armed forces just abandoning them after 22 years to go and start again at something completely different in life without support untill normal retirement age.

attributes.action: Stop penalising ex Veterens on their war pensions.
attributes.background: I want the government to stop penalising ex veterans who claim a war pension, but have to surrender most of it because they are out of work and claim benefits.

attributes.action: Exempt charge of £30(min)for letter to Unis from GPs re health of applicants.
attributes.background: Daughter has applied to Universities who requested letter from GP regarding her health. Local surgery have insisted on a payment of £30 claiming this is a NON-NHS service (apparently charges £30-55). How come a 'sick note' non chargeable to adults but students need to pay for a simple letter?
attributes.additional_details: The GP surgery required a payment of £30.  When questioned the Assistant Practice Manager advised that payment was in line with Government guidelines of £30- 55.  Personally think this is outrageous given students now required to pay for education and this is another hidden cost to any student wanting to go to Uni (costs of which are prohibitive to most).

attributes.action: Ban child contact for violent fathers
attributes.background:
Reforms need to be introduce into family court to end the presumption that a father must have contact with a child where there is evidence of domestic abuse that would put the child&mother at risk
There are cases where children have been killed by their violent father due to contact given by judges

attributes.action: refunds should be given for bets placed on non starters
attributes.background: many punters are losing out in singles doubles trebles fc/tc. placepots etc. I and the majority if not all punters would like a refund if a horse refuses to start the race. It is wrong at the highest level. we don't want a free bet where you don't get your stake back. we just want refunded.
attributes.additional_details: 3.10 Newcastle 23 January 2017 horse Bigirononhiship failed to start. no run for my money I lost single and fc bet placed.

attributes.action: The banning of plastic carrier bags and plastic bottles.
attributes.background: Plastic carrier bags and plastic bottles have a MASSIVE detrimental impact on the world environment. Charging for these items in supermarkets etc is not enough. If they are not there we cannot buy them. These plastics are entering our food chain. Ban them now and make the world a better place.

attributes.action: be able to self-exclude from book makers and casinos for more then a year
attributes.background: I know from experience and self banning use to be five years now it's only one year and that's not enough we should at least have a right to choose how long we can ban ourselves for.

attributes.action: Professionals completing babies checks, to screen mums for PND during 1st year
attributes.background: I am a mum of two children. I suffered PND with my second child. I had been to gp before birth but was told too close to birth to be given medication. I was then left and not checked. 14wks post birth I was in a really dark, scary place. Had it been checked during those 1st weeks id had gotten help

attributes.action: When referring to our Debt state what we owe not what % it is of something else.
attributes.background: Since 1947 our Debt increased from £25 bn to £1,547 bn but when compared to GDP it allows Gov to conceal from us their out of control spending and borrowing of more than £2 bn every week for 10 years. For more alarming facts about the way Gov run our Country see www.mrms.uk
attributes.additional_details: A debt is “a sum of money owed” and should be referred to as such. There is no logical reason why Government should compare our National Debt to GDP (or anything else) other than to keep the truth from us of their out of control spending and borrowing.

attributes.action: Reading Prison as an Enterprise Zone for new Businesses.
attributes.background: This petition proposes the multiuse development of Reading Prison. The Grade II-listed building would be used as a ‘Business Incubator’ where start-up companies share communal infrastructure but operate within a designated space themselves. The remaining site would be a residential development.
attributes.additional_details:
This site is perfect for new businesses, with access to the station as well as supporting industries in the surrounding area.
Existing centres of innovation (The University and Business parks) could be sources of collaboration.
Ernst and Young forecasts Reading to be the fastest growing local economy in the UK, making this a pivotal moment in Reading's economic future.
The prison site will enable a diverse range of new businesses to develop, further spreading Reading’s prosperity.

attributes.action: The Jury Should be Scrapped.
attributes.background: I feel that the jury should be scrapped due to the impact that the decision will have on the persons life. If the ECJ doesn't use a jury, why should other courts.

attributes.action: Make mansard and loft extensions permitted development in non-conservation areas
attributes.background: Mansard and loft extensions for terrace properties require planning permission.  This gives local authorities the power to refuse on design ground even when there is no objections from local residents.  These type of extensions should be automatically permitted except in conservation areas.

attributes.action: When selecting route for HS3 include Manchester to carlisle.
attributes.background: HS2 is meant to provide a link from the North to the south. A full upgrade of the UK railway network is required to reach the actual North of England carlisle  in place of targeted more advanced areas where spending is already in place.

attributes.action: Make 16+ Zip Oyster cards a form of legal age identification for purchases.
attributes.background: Isn't it annoying going to the cinema and being turned away because you don't have any "accepted ID" on you? Trying to buy lottery tickets for your family? It isn't right that to be able to do these things, you have to carry your passport around, when there's a perfectly good ZIP card in your pocket

attributes.action: Do not ban fireworks to the public but increase the age of sale to 25 minimum.
attributes.background: Thousands of people respectively enjoy garden fireworks and use them accordingly, why should the whole nation have that taken away from them because of a few peoples irresponsible use of fireworks? It's not fair that everyone should pay because of a few.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks have been used since the 12th century, animals and people have coped fine, animal owners have information widely available to them to help their animals cope. Lifting the age of sale to 25 will help stop the irresponsible use of fireworks. It is simply not fair to spoil it for everyone because of a few!

attributes.action: Make it a legal obligation to have a mobile phone holder/mount fitted in cars.
attributes.background: It should be a legal obligation to have a phone dock, holder or mount fitted in your car to pass an MOT. It is illegal to have your phone in your hand while driving but for most, unfortunately it continues to be a problem. We hope to reduce the deaths associated with mobile phone use while driving.
attributes.additional_details: A recent video showed a lorry driver crashing into a line of cars, including one full of a family, because he was on his phone. He would not have taken his eyes off the road if he had had his mobile phone in a mount. It is devastating what has happened to this family, but for the driver as well. All he did was something that Everyone does at one time or another and he was unlucky. A family were killed instantly, this could have been avoided.

attributes.action: change the law on websites listing companies without the owners permission
attributes.background: Parliament needs to change the law on how websites list companies without the company owners permission. It should be up to the business owner to decide where and how their business is displayed and advertised, and be removed from any website at the owners request.

attributes.action: Mandatory Client Money Protection for Letting Agents
attributes.background: The Government is less than lukewarm about making it mandatory that all Landlord and Tenant money is safely held in Client Accounts and covered by insurance policies. Some of our present Landlords have lost thousands with agents that have closed down and run off with money they banked from Tenants.
attributes.additional_details:
A solicitor, conveyancer or even a financial adviser is not afforded the same trust. Unfortunately the small minority of agents do, often, run away with large sums of money!

Why are we as agents so poorly regulated?

Further discussion and details here: https://www.aaronjbarclay.co.uk/should-client-money-protection-be-mandatory. Estate agents in London and beyond should be made to comply.

Please sign if you feel this is a worthy petition.

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory, age appropriate theatre arts policy for KS2 year groups
attributes.background: Introduce a mandatory KS2 theatre arts policy that prevents schools from putting up annual plays that are age inappropriate with adult, sexist humour,that promote jaded stereotypes like flapper girls & have little or no educational merit.Is it fair, for only Y6 to perform on stage & not Y3,Y4 & Y5?
attributes.additional_details: I ask this because my daughter’s school believes that the annual school play is to showcase only Y6 children on stage, while it is perfectly justified for Y3, Y4 & Y5 children to be relegated below the stage, on chairs,getting up to sing collectively,for only 8-14 minutes in a 60-70 minutes long production, for 3 successive years, before they are allowed to perform on stage,largely in unsuitable,tasteless plays that validate outdated, objectionable attitudes and behaviours insidiously, in kids.

attributes.action: All telecoms personnel in the UK should be licensed
attributes.background: I have experienced poor service from a telecoms provider, which resulted in me being given 2.6-2.8 Mb when 10-15Mb was freely available at my home. People who work in the telecoms industry have a great deal of power, and should be licensed and checked before they can work.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered over the years with a controlled censorship on my business lines resulting in call drop outs at an alarming rate,  yet when I called the 1471 service 99.9% of these callers were unavailable which I find very odd. Yet friends and family and established clients have no problems contacting me. The present system is out of date and Ofcom needs more power to regulate the industry. Security is a major problem - there are 2000 calls a day to Action Fraud.

attributes.action: All Referendums should be fought on the Parliamentary Election Register
attributes.background: I am petitioning Referendum should be fought on the Parliamentary Election Register not the Local Government register for all future referendums in the UK
